com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server
Class Player

java.lang.Object
  com.googlecode.csse460_2010.server.Player

public class Player
extends java.lang.Object

Player contains all the necessary information about a player of the game.

Author:
Christopher Rabotin

Nested Class Summary
static class Player.States
          There are only two types of States for the player: IDLE and in COMBAT

addAttack

public void addAttack(Attack e)
Adds an attack to the list of available attacks of the player.

Parameters:
e - an Attack to add.

addPoints

public void addPoints(int tba)
Adds points to the player's points.

Parameters:
tba - number of points to be added to the player's current points.

beatify

public void beatify()
Call this method to change the player into a God of the game. The attacks of a God are ten times as powerful and he/she only get ten times as less damage when getting an attack.

getState

public Player.States getState()
Getter for the state of the player. If the daemon which is in the player's room is dead but the player is still in COMBAT state, then we update the state of this player to IDLE. This race condition occurs when two or more players are simultaneously fighting the same daemon: only the player who defeats it gets his/her state changed.

Returns:
the state of the player.

isAlive

public boolean isAlive()
Getter to check if the current player is still alive.

Returns:
whether the player is alive or not.

isBlessed

public boolean isBlessed()
Checks whether a player is a God or not.

Returns:
whether the player is in godmode or not.

lowerHealth

public void lowerHealth(int ouch)
Subtracts health points to the player. If the player has no more points, the died() method is called.

Parameters:
ouch - number of health points to be subtracted from the player's points

lowerPoints

public void lowerPoints(int tbl)
Lower the player's points. This function is called only when the player learns a new attack.

Parameters:
tbl -

reset

public void reset()
This method is called when a new game is about to start: it sends the player to the starting room, revives him/her and puts him in the IDLE state.

setRoom

public void setRoom(Room r)
Changes the room of the player. If the new room has a daemon and it is alive, then the player's state is changed to COMBAT.

Parameters:
r - the room to which the player will be moved.

setState

public void setState(Player.States state)
Setter for the state of the player.

Parameters:
state -
